group_1.narration: From then on,@filming proceeded at a quick pace.

group_1.textLeft: I had a lovely time today, Tsukihiko.

group_1.textRight: And I as well, Ruri.

group_1.textLeft: May I...@see you again soon, by any chance?

group_1.textRight: Yes!@By all means.
Nice to meet you, Ruri!

group_1.textLeft: Hello there.

group_1.textRight: Pleasure t' see you today, ma'am!
...I have to apologize.
My sisters were very insistent about accompanying@us today.

group_1.textLeft: I don't mind at all.@...It's a pleasure to meet you both, girls.

group_1.textRight: I've reserved some seats for us at a local eatery.@"Walnut's," I believe the name is.
Its head chef is trained in European cuisine, and it's@gotten a fair bit of good press lately.

group_1.textLeft: ...So, what wish did you make?@To the shrine's god.

group_1.textRight: We've got an important business meeting coming up,@so I'll be off to the capital tomorrow morning.
So I wished for the meeting to proceed smoothly...
Such that I can return to Kamihama without a@second's delay.
What about you, Ruri?

group_1.textLeft: I wished...
*Giggle*. I think I'll keep it a secret!

group_1.narration: As Ruri and Tsukihiko became@ever more enchanted with one another,@over the course of their many rendezvous...
So, too, did the gulf between East and West@that surrounded them become more apparent.

group_1.textRight: Is something the matter?

group_1.textLeft: Well, you see...
I happened to shake hands with Tsukihiko's younger@sisters just a short while ago.
And they both had just the most AWFULLY rough@skin...

group_1.textRight: Really?

group_1.textLeft: Yet they ought to be able to hire dozens of maids,@given their fortune.
Are they forcing their own daughters to do the@housework as well...?
I can't help but feel concern for Ruri, marrying into@a house like that...

group_1.textRight: Hm? ...Ah!@Psst, behind you!

group_1.textLeft: Mm?
I-I'm so sorry.@That was no way for me to speak.

group_1.textRight: D-don't worry! Ami-senpai was just acting, she didn't@really mean...

group_1.textLeft: I'm sorry, Riko! I know how it sounded, but she@didn't mean that for real.
Ami was just following the script, so...

group_1.textRight: ...Huh? Oh, I know!@I'm not actually upset.
I know I'm just supposed to stand there and listen@for this scene...
But I got so into the role, I could actually feel myself@getting teary!

group_1.textLeft: So, in other words... you were just ad-libbing in a@particularly realistic way?
Oh, thank goodness. I was so shocked, I thought I'd@actually made you cry.

group_1.textRight: So it was a genuine reaction in your case...! Well,@we did get some very good footage out of it.

group_1.narration: Kamihama's fracture between East and West@dates back centuries ago.
According to Komachi, hostilities first became@truly entrenched during the Sengoku period...
...when Mizuna Castle tragically fell@as a result of betrayal by East-based forces.
The grudge over these events lingered deeply,@and present-day Mizuna is still host to@many people who despise residents of the East.

group_1.textLeft: ...Our families are from Kamihama too, after all.
We should've been more aware of how sensitive a@topic we were handling.

group_1.textRight: Indeed. I'm very sorry.

group_1.textLeft: N-no, it's okay! Really! I heard the whole story when@I first signed up and everything!

group_1.textRight: Yeah, same here. We're having fun, so don't worry@about it!

group_1.textLeft: Well, I'm happy to hear that...

group_1.textRight: ...This is really something.
Even an elementary-schooler like Chiaki is getting@completely absorbed in her role.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah. Looks like I've got some tough competition as@the lead actor...!

group_1.textRight: Um, Komachi...?
